text: Consider an undirected graph G. Let T be a depth first search traversal tree. Let u be a vertex and v be the first unvisited vertex after visiting u. Which of the following statements is always true? (A)(u, v)must be an edge in G (B) (u, v) must be an edge and v is a descendant of uin T (Q) if (u, v) is not an edge, u and v have the same parent. 7.0 (SN @017 14 0ยง21 1H0) XN VAN N (D) N LN (@ 2 1 Uy (ed R 8) 2N 2) Page 76 (D) if (u, v) is not an edge, then u is a leaf.
